metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3838 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An exploitable information vulnerability exists in the XCF image renderingfunctionality of Simple DirectMedia Layer SDL2_image-2.0.2. A speciallycrafted XCF image can cause an out-of-bounds read on the heap, resulting ininformation disclosure. An attacker can display a specially crafted imageto trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.0+dfsg-3+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-3+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
